column3:
Generally, you must pay all of the costs from providers up to the deductible amount
before this plan begins to pay. If you have other family members on the plan, each
family member must meet their own individual deductible until the total amount of
deductible expenses paid by all family members meets the overall family deductible.

column1:
Are there services covered
before you meet your
deductible?
column2:
Yes. Does not apply to copayments,
certain prescription drugs and services
listed below as ?No charge.?
column3:
This plan covers some items and services even if you haven?t yet met the deductible
amount. But a copayment or coinsurance may apply. For example, this plan covers
certain preventive services without cost-sharing and before you meet your deductible.
See a list of covered preventive services at https://www.healthcare.gov/coverage/
preventive-care-benefits/.

column1:
Are there other deductibles for
specific services?
column3: You don?t have to meet deductibles for specific services.

column1:
What is the out-of-pocket limit
for this plan?
column3:
The out-of-pocket limit is the most you could pay in a year for covered services.
If you have other family members in this plan, they have to meet their own out-of-pocket limits until the overall family out-of-pocket limit has been met.

column1:
What is not included in the
out-of-pocket limit?
column2:
Premium, balance-billed charges,
penalties for failure to obtain prior
authorization for services, and health
care this plan doesn't cover.
column3: Even though you pay these expenses, they don?t count toward the out-of-pocket limit.

column1:
Will you pay less if you use a
network provider?
column2:
Yes. See Individual Signature medical
network. For a list of in-network
providers, see http://www.premera.com
or call 1-800-607-0546.
column3:
This plan uses a provider network. You will pay less if you use a provider in the plan?s
network. You will pay the most if you use an out-of-network provider, and you might
receive a bill from a provider for the difference between the provider?s charge and
what your plan pays (balance billing).
Be aware your network provider might use an out-of-network provider for some
services (such as lab work). Check with your provider before you get services.

column1:
Do you need a referral to see a
specialist?
column3: You can see the specialist you choose without a referral.
